meanings.definition: The act of limiting or controlling something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher imposed a restriction on the number of snacks allowed in class.
meanings.sent2: The restriction on screen time helped the children focus on their homework.
meanings.sent3: The restriction on dessert made the kids pout, but they knew it was for their own good.
meanings.sent4: The restriction on outdoor play felt like a heavy weight on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The restriction on talking during the test made the room eerily quiet.

meanings.definition: A rule or regulation that limits or controls something.
meanings.sent1: The new restriction on parking caused confusion among the residents.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring the speed limit restriction can result in a fine.
meanings.sent3: The restriction on wearing hats indoors seemed silly to the students.
meanings.sent4: The restriction on using cell phones in the library was strictly enforced.
meanings.sent5: The restriction on bringing pets to school was met with disappointment by the students.

meanings.definition: A limitation or constraint on something.
meanings.sent1: The budget restriction prevented them from going on a vacation.
meanings.sent2: The time restriction for the exam added pressure to the students.
meanings.sent3: The restriction on the number of toppings for the pizza seemed unfair to the hungry group.
meanings.sent4: The restriction on the number of guests at the party made the invitation list challenging.
meanings.sent5: The restriction on the use of the pool during winter kept the water pristine.
